title: Not worth it
text: Fairly unpleasant and glad to leave. Nothing special to see if you have been to similar markets and a hassle when “guides” won’t leave you alone.

title: Eye Opening!
text: This market is both organized and chaotic. I'm sure that doesn't make too much sense but that's how I can describe it. It's like your typical market- fruits, vegetables, general goods, clothing- you name it. It's broken up in sections so all like items are within the same area. It's not for the faint of heart so you've never experienced outdoor markets from anywhere in the developing world, I suggest a guide or proceed with caution. It's safe, no one will bother you. It can be overwhelming and you may get some talkative vendors here and there. I felt very comfortable walking around with someone who was familiar with the do's and don'ts of the market, so I was very happy to have a guide. I learned a lot about the market through him as well. He even treated me to fruits, and showed me some less traveled areas in the market that I surely would not have been able to easily do had I gone solo. If you're interested, his name is Kebba and he can be contacted via WhatsApp at +220 342 1046. I even contacted him on such short notice and he was able to arrange a tour for me within just a couple of hours! He's extremely professional, reasonably priced, excellent English speaking skills, and former Gambian military, so you're in very trusted hands.

title: ''Καλό''
text: Μεγάλη υπαίθρια αγορά που μπορείτε να ψωνίσετε τα πάντα σε σχέση με το σπίτι,φαγητό και για τους τουρίστες αν ενδιαφέρονται αναμνηστικά.Λατρεύουν το παζάρι στις τιμές!!

title: Great The Gambia Market For Everything
text:
We walked and shoppes through all the sections of this market that sells household goods, clothes, produce, fresh meats, spices, handicrafys and souvenirs. We could not resist fresh fruits, a souvenir shirt of The Gambia, and some good réplica of husos made into decor.  We spent time learning about various qualities, origins, and weaving componentes of colorgul fabrics.  
Vendors were generally pleasant with only a few marketing their goods with extra enthusiam. 
The market can be fun and can also have challenges.  Everyone speaks English. 
Delightful market

title: Gezelligheid kent geen tijd.
text: Gezellig/ lekker afdingen vergeet dit niet, dit is normaal / tijdstippen liefs in de ochtend i.v.m. warmte en drukte..

title: AMBIANCE ANIMEE
text:
Nous avons découvert Banjul, la capitale de la Gambie, située sur l'île Sainte-Marie. Nous avons exploré le marché Albert, un trésor urbain offrant une variété de produits et une ambiance animée. Ensuite, nous avons visité l'Arche 22, un arc de triomphe construit pour commémorer un coup d'État. Cette structure imposante offre une vue panoramique sur la ville et abrite un musée.
VOYAGEAVECNOUS.COM
FB ET INSTA AUTOURDUMONDE2023

title: Market visit Banjul
text: It’s a tourist market mainly . Very repetitive. But some nice hand made prices . You have to haggle but stuff is junk really. You cannot take photos of locals unless you buy from them. It is not safe to go alone as you get too much hassle and pick picketers . Our taxi driver accompanied us so no hassle at all. Didn’t buy  much but  nice to see locals selling their food. You can also see junta minutes island from there.

title: Bitter Kola
text: I like Gambians and the fact that they patronize us alot with our Nigerian BITTER KOLA. Love you guys

title: Smelly but good experience
text: Smelly and dusty but good experience. We visited this market with Buba tours. It was a nice experience to see the local stalls but be prepared for bad smell, mosquitos and people trying to attract your attention. We bought some wood crafts and cookies here. Visit this market with a good guide (like Buba tours) to find your way back out and to help you bargain at the prices.

title: Sollte man gesehen haben wenn man Banjul besucht.
text: Der Royal Albert Market ist sicher ein Besuch wert. Ich habe es mit einem Guide gemacht der mich angesprochen hat. Es war ein guter Griff denn ich durfte fast alles auch die Menschen fotografieren. Was sonst nicht möglich wäre und ist. Den fotografieren ist generell auf Märkte unerwünscht. Der Markt selbst ist überschaubar und man bekommt alles was man braucht oder nicht braucht inkl Souvenirs und Kunsthandwerk. Der Guide wollte dann für seine Dienste 800 dal was natürlich viel zu viel ist. Ich gab 200 dal und es war auch ok.

title: Nie ma rewelacji
text: Widzialem wiele rynkow w roznych częściach swiata. Ten pokazuje jak biedna jest Afryka ( choc Gambia z krajow afrykanskich ktore widzialem nie jest najgorsza).Masa chinskiej tandety .Zywnosc, owoce, mieso .Sprzedawane w warunkach takich jakie sa. Poprostu widac tu biede tego kraju.Owszem kupisz prawdziwe rekodziela ale to chyba jedyny plus tego rynku. Uwielbiam miejsca tego typu , ale to mnie przytloczylo. To jeszcze bardziej otwiera oczy na różnicę pomiedzy Europa i innymi czesciami swiata , a Afryka.

title: No point
text: Nothing to see except locals buying cheap Chinese rubbish and food. In a very crowded, hot and dirty environemnt. No lcal crafts or anything worth actually seeing. If you go in as a white person, you will be followed by some random Gambian people who will try and control where you go, engage in pointless conversation, ask for money etc. If you ignore them or don't engage, they will start shouting that you are racist and won't speak to black people. Avoid.

title: Good market
text: It's a good market for food, toiletries, fabric, fruits and crafts. I got some Sheabutter from the market

title: Besøg værd
text: Helt sikkert besøg værd. Man skal dog kunne klare den megen uro, lugt, manglende toiletter og desperate sælgere, som vil gøre hvad som helst for at få solgt.

title: Lokalt og fargerikt
text: Her tar du ikke med barna, til det er det litt for skittent og primitivt, men for en opplevelse! Fargerikt, lokalt marked der ting produseres på gammeldags vis. Jeg fikk raskt en "guide" på slep som skulle ha meg inn til den turistifiserte delen, men jeg overhørte ham så godt jeg kunne. Kjempespenende å rusle rundt i den lokale delen av markedet! Ikke noe å kjøpe for meg ihvertfall men interessant å se.

title: Johan oli markkinat
text:
Todella isot markkinat. Pienet, kapeat ja mutkittelevat kujat. Täynnä erilaisia tuoksuja ja hajuja sekaisin kalan, lihan ja kaikkien muiden hajut. Kujat ovat katettuja ja ahtaita. Todella paljon kaikkea myynnissä. Vaatteita, ruoka tarvikkeita ja paikallisia käsitöitä.
Kannattaa ottaa paikallinen opas niin ei eksy.

title: Not for the faint hearted
text:
We had a free trip and choose among others The Albert Market.
Its big,busy ,sticks of fish but not to be missed,its Gambia the tourists dont see ,you could get lost there ,every one seems to be selling fish,vegetables and spices,oh dont go to the tourist part to get ripped of .
if you get the chance go but take a quide

title: Niet fameus.
text: S’morgens hier bezoek gebracht. Markt zelf stelt niet veel voor. Veel kraampjes niet open. Weg er naartoe was wel leuk. Kijk ook even op het strand achter de markt.

title: Lugar asqueroso
text:
He estado en muchos mercados de África y como este ninguno: moscas hasta en la ropa... Olor a cloaca por todos lados, suciedad y basura hasta en los puestos de comida. Ratas en los puestos de carne y pescado. 
Terrible!

title: Toeristische markt, leuk rondje
text:
Leuk rondje over de markt. Hier naartoe geweest i.c.m. de serekunda market. Hele dag met de taxichauffeur. Is ook wel makkelijk, zodat je niet aan de weg hoeft te denken. Markt is erg toeristisch, maar je loopt er met je 'privé-gids' aardig relaxt rond. Probeer de koffie eens. Craft market is ook erg leuk, wel toeristische prijzen. Daardoor uiteindelijk niets meer gekocht, immers prijzen lagen hoger dan in 'thuisland'. Wel mooie producten, vooral van hout. Leuk om eens gezien te hebben.
Absoluut ver afdingen. 

Tip: combineer dit met een bezoek aan de serekunda market. Deze is minder of nauwelijks toeristisch. Waar de taxichauffeur bij de Albert market aangaf dat er niet zo heel snel werd gestolen, werd nu bij de eerste stap buiten de auto gezegd om de tas op je buik te doen. Al met al 't is relaxter om gewoon niets mee te nemen, want het is enorm druk en je stoot tegen alles en iedereen aan. Smalle doorgangen in achteraf straatjes. Koop hier een grote zak pinda's als je nog naar het monkey park wilt gaan!

title: Marknad med allt
text:
Albert market är en otroligt stor marknad, slingrande marknadsvaror som inte går att hålla koll på. Stora kontraster där det säljs upphittade begagnade saker till mer moderna. Träsniderier, läderarbeten mm.
Från underbara kryddofter och färsk frukt till enligt mig rutten fisk och härsket kött.
Pruta på allt, och ger dom inte med sig så gå vidare till nästa.
Ta gärna en guidad tur om ni ska hit.

title: De markt van de markten!
text:
Alles maar dan ook alles kan je er kopen of wordt te koop aangeboden.
Van koelkasten to verse vis, van kleding tot auto onderdelen.
Veel mensen bieden van alles aan, mannen, vrouwen, kinderen.......
Men spreekt er uitstekend engels en dat is handig in de onderhandelingen.
Laat je begeleiden door iemand bv de taxichauffeur, want het is een doolhof in het kwadraat........
Veel plezier......

title: Authentiek en kleurrijke hectiek
text: Deze openluchtmarkt mag je niet overslaan bij een bezoek aan Gambia. Hier worden je zintuigen intens geprikkeld door de mêlee aan geuren, kleuren en indrukken van de markt. Hier is praktisch alles te koop. Van textiel, (huishoudelijke) gebruiksvoorwerpen, specerijen en kruiden, ambachtelijke producten met vooral houtsnijwerk tot en met levensmiddelen waaronder ‘verse’ vis en vlees. Aan koelen van vis en vlees wordt hier overigens niet gedaan en dat bij temperaturen van wel 30 graden Celsius. Af en toe moet je een sterke maag hebben. Bijgebleven is mij het beeld van een handkar met daarop opgetaste, afgehakte runderkoppen met onder de kar een grote plas vers bloed. Eromheen een giga zwerm aan vliegende en kruipende insecten. Richtlijnen met betrekking tot zaken als hygiëne en voedselveiligheid, zoals wij die kennen, zullen hier meer dan waarschijnlijk onbekend zijn. Het geheel lijkt een grote chaos met een enorme massa aan kopende en verkopende mensen in hun zeer kleurrijke gewaden. Aan te bevelen is wel om dit bezoek met een gids te doen. En zelfs dan moet je er enigszins de vaart inhouden. Sta je bij een kraam iets te lang, dan wordt je geacht iets te kopen. Dat kan natuurlijk, maar vergeet dan niet af te dingen tot wel 30% van de vraagprijs. Van foto’s maken is men niet erg gecharmeerd, ook als een gids erbij is. Vraag het aan de mensen of doe het met ‘beleid’, d.w.z. zoom niet in op mensen maar houdt het beperkt tot het maken van sfeerbeelden. Interessant was zeker de demonstratie die we kregen om door het omsmelten van ingezamelde, aluminium frisdrankblikjes, potten, pannen, lepels en schuimspanen te maken. Ik kan iedereen echt aanbevelen deze markt te bezoeken; niets geeft een beter beeld weer van het dagelijkse leven in Afrika dan dit.

title: Zwiedzanie
text: Miejsce konieczne do zwiedzenia ale najlepiej z zaufanym lokalnym przewodnikiem. Można go znaleźć przed hotelem Atlantic pierwsze skrzyżowanie do miasta lub na plaży przy hotelu lub a najlepiej pytać o Alex/Willy Rasta często jest w corner obok hotelu poznasz po fladze polskiej.

title: zeker een bezoekje waard
text:
Deze markt hebben wij bezocht met onze taxi driver. Je komt op de markt ogen tekort. Een bepaald gedeelte van de markt verkopen ze erg veel kruiden,  veel verschillende soorten groeten en vis.  Een ander gedeelte van de markt verkopen ze geen levensmiddelen maar houtsnijwerk, stoffen ed.   Je kijkt je ogen uit.  De mensen zijn er over het algemeen vriendelijk.  Wanneer je foto's wil maken is het verstandig om even te checken of ze hier voor open staan.
We hebben er een klein beeldje (houtsnijwerk)  gekocht.  Denk eraan dat je gaat onderhandelen.   Wij kwamen uit op een prijs die bijna 70% lager was  ;)

title: Myllrande marknad
text: Spännande marknad i den väldigt lilla huvudstaden Banjul. Här finns verkligen ett stort utbud, köpte själv en bordsduk och en hatt. Det är allt mellan himmel och jord som säljs, även mat som ligger ute i värmen och drar till sig flugor förstås. Men det var en trevlig upplevelse. Vi var inte så köpsugna dock, utan ville mest uppleva marknaden.

title: Trångt, mycket folk, intressant
text:
Åkte dit då vi hade hört mycket om platsen samt att vi ville känna hur pulsen var i det "riktiga" Gambia. Ska dock med en gång sägas att detta inte är den största marknaden fast det är i huvudstaden. 
Detta var en riktigt intressant upplevelse men personligen känner jag att räcker med att vara där en gång. Marknaden är verkligen för lokalbefolkningens dagliga behov och de bryr sig inte nämnvärt om turisterna som är där, tills du kommer till souvenirer!
Det är mycket folk och varje kvadratmm används till försäljning. Det står saker precis överallt och precis allt säljs. I den gamla marknadsplatsen som sägs härleda till ett par hundra år tillbaka i tiden kan du nästan känna hur tiden dras tillbaka. På ett speciellt ställe finner du också kött- och fiskmarknaden och jag kan lugnt säga att den inte direkt skulle klara av det svenska livsmedelsverkets riktlinjer. Här styckas köttbitar och fiskar rensas helt öppet med flugor precis överallt. Doften kan vara överväldigande för den som inte är beredd och det ligger köttslamsor lite överallt på golvet/marken. De färdigstyckade bitarna läggs sedan i frysar som fylls med is. Köper du kött läggs is i påsen med köttet för att bevara färskheten.
Som jag skrev tidigare bryr sig inte säljarna om dig nämnvärt men detta ändras i samma sekund som du tar dig in i delen där de säljer souvenirer. Så snart du ens tanken på att beträda denna del hoppar samtliga säljare fram och vill ha in dig i just hans eller hennes försäljningsstånd. Det kan lätt bli lite svettigt då du blir väldigt påpassad. Men precis som i övriga Gambia är det ingen som är otrevlig. Tvärtom! Alla är väldigt trevliga och vill dig bara väl, men de är också angelägna om att sälja. 
Jag rekommenderar att ta dig dit med lokalguide då du dels får det betydligt billigare än att åka med turisterna samt att du har en person som kan språket och möjligen också kan hjälpa dig att pruta. Bor du i närheten av Senegambia rekommenderar jag Bob som vi åkte med varje dag till olika ställen samt att han även bjöd med oss två kvällar med hans vänner på reggaefester. Kontakta honom på Whats App på nr +220 757 9974.

title: Echte afrikaanse markt !!!!
text:
Enkele uren rond gelopen op deze markt .Ogen te kort om alles gezien te hebben ,alles is er te koop en honderden mensen trachten hun waar aan de man te brengen .Sommigen worden boos wanneer je fotos trekt en vragen geld .Tussen alle rommel ,kleren,huisgerief tref je ook een beenhouwerij aan ,de maden kruipen over de grond en alles is bedekt met duizende vliegen .vele vis standjes in de zelfde omstandigheden .

Zeker de moeite waard .

title: Här finns allt att köpa !
text: En taxichaufför tog mig med på marknaden och han kände många som hade sina försäljningsställen på "Albert Market". Marknaden täcker en stor yta nära Gambiafloden.På Marknaden finns kläder -skor -konstverk -grönsaker och fisk bland annat.

title: Overdekte warenmarkt
text: Grote warenmarkt waar veel te koop is. Verwacht geen kwaliteitsproducten. Vlees en vis liggen ongekoeld uitgestald. En dat temperaturen ruim boven de dertig graden. Groenten en kruiden zien er goed en vers uit. Lekker dwalen tussen de stalletjes. Ook de plek om kleding te laten vermaken.

title: Afrikaanse markt zoals een Afrikaanse markt hoort te zijn.
text: Heb daar een paar uur rondgelopen met een local als gids. Ik verbaasde me over de vele vliegen bij de vis maar de gids meldde me dat die visjes 's=ochtends nog rondegzwommen hadden en dus razend vers zijn en de mensen geen koelkast hebben dus dit is hun manier van vis vis vers houden. Di paar vliegen bak je gewoon even niet mee.

title: Albertmarkt
text: Nichts fūr schwache Mågen und Nerven.Der Geruch verursacht Wūrgereiz.Wer ihn ein Mal sieht braucht ihn nicht nochmal.

title: Der 3. Market  in Gambia
text:
Der Albert Markt war unser 3. Markt in Gambia. 
Souvenirs etwas teurer als Craft Market bakau. 
Ansonsten eine gute Mischung von Dingen für Einheimische und Touristen. 

Hier kann man auch ohne Führer gehen ohne sich zu verlaufen .

title: Ganz nett
text: Albert Market sollten jene besuchen, die erstmals einen afrikanischen Markt besuchen. Er ist nicht groß, Stände sind überschaubar, aber trotzdem kriegt man Einblick in Kunsthandwertk, Obst-, Gemüse- und Fischverkauf. Wer mit dem FTI Bus ankommt, kriegt wahrscheinlich nicht viel mit, da ca. 40 Personen durch die schmalen Wege, die gleichzeitig als Verkaufsfläche dienen, gescheucht werden. Dann vorzugsweise allein mit dem Taxi anreisen. Wer mehr Aufregung und Trubel sucht, stürzt sich lieber in den Serekunda Marekt.

title: Excellent african market experience.
text: Watch your wallet gents. Ladies do not carry a handbag. Do NOT wear jewellery. ( you become a target). Professional PICKPOCKETS everywhere .Its like Fagin and Oliver Twist.. EVERY TRICK IN THE PICKPOCKETS BOOK. you would not believe it unless you experienced it.!!!

title: Fascinerend
text: Erg boeiend en authentiek ! Nog beter met lokale gids die heel interessante weetjes vertelt. De moeite waard.

title: Big market
text: This Albert market is biggest market in Banjul and I think, it is biggest market in the whole Gambia. From here you can find allkind of souvenirs, shoes, clothes, fabrics, food etc. Market is under the metal roof (African style), so you can visit there also in Rain days.

title: Hier findet man alles
text: Ein Markt, wo Einheimische ihre Sachen anbieten. Egal ob Obst, Gemüse oder Fisch. Für Touristen gibt es mehrere Souvenirläden. Sogar eine Näherei ist vorhanden.

title: Day trip to the craft market
text:
If you like negotiating then you need to attend this market. Almost everything is up for negotiation. 

You’ll love it just like it did.

title: Authentic local market
text:
This is a very large local market, where you can buy anything.
The shop owners can see that you are a tourist, so if it is a fish shop they won't bother you, but those selling local clothes and handicrafts can be rather annoying. They don't take no for an answer.
Go with a local guide, or you may get lost.

title: Afrikanischer Markt
text: Der Royal Albert Markt in Banjul ist Erlebnis pur. Es werden unendlich viele typische afrikanische Waren angeboten, von Kunsthandwerk über Batik, Schmuck, Holzschnitzereien, Bekleidung bis Taschen, Stoffen aller Art u.v.m. Größtenteils werden die in kleinen Ständen angebotenen Waren noch individuell handwerklich hergestellt. Ein Muss für jeden Gambia-Besucher. Allerdings sollte man keine Vorbehalte vor dem direkten Kontakt zu den stets freundlichen Anbietern haben und sich in den teils engen Gassen zwischen den Ständen nicht fürchten. Ansonsten den Markt vorsorglich mit einem einheimischen Begleiter (z. B. dem Taxifahrer) besuchen.

title: Ett ställe som man aldrig glömmer
text:
Denna utflykt var spännande på alla vis. 

Tur att man hade guide med sig annars hade vi gått där än haha . 
Otroligt trångt med mycket intryck allt från lukter till känslor . 

Vi handlade en del saker man fick pruta rejält . 
Kan rekommendera TT åka dit.

title: Typisch Afrikaanse markt
text: Een leuke, typisch Afrikaanse markt waar naast de etenswaren ook veel handgemaakte zaken en andere goederen te koop zijn. Bijzondere ervaring was het deel met veel Afrikaanse kleermakers. Mooie tour met dank aan onze gids

title: Eye opening
text: This place was amazing. Our taxi driver took us here and showed us round. It was a really busy market selling everything but it's worth it more for the experience than to buy stuff.

title: En massa saker att köpa....
text: En marknadsplats med varor i mängder. Inte mycket att se förutom det. Trångt luktar mindre gott och försäljare som är på dig.  1 timme räcker för att se denna marknad som finns många liknande på andra platser.

title: Veel leuker dan Serakunda
text: Echt nog een originele markt met alleen maar lokale mensen. Standaard dingen zoals vis,fruit vlees, kleren etc gewoon leuk en een uitstekend stuk craft waar nog hele mooie dingen te vinden zijn

title: Myllrande marknad
text: Västafrikas största marknad. Tur att vi hade vår vän Salomon med oss annars hade vi nog virrat omkring än. Jag har ju varit på många marknader i världen den här var nog den mest färgrika. Alla dessa vackra textilier. Köpte endel men kunde köpt mer. Lokala killar kommer gärna och hänger sig på fast man har en inhemsk med sig. Men det hade nog varit fler om inte han varit med oss. Hjälpte till med prutning mm. Grönsaker, kryddor, fisk i mängder. Kunde gått där hela dagen. Får bli ett till besök där. Vi var inte på delen med hantverk, så det får vara nästa mål.

title: Albert Market
text: Рынок огорчил. Очень много китайского ширпотреба, причем все это висит, лежит, стоит на самых видных и приоритетных местах. Но, если углубиться в палатку и внимательно изучить товар, можно найти африканские текстильные изделия и деревянные поделки.

title: Noise from the locals
text: The famous Albert market of Banjul is one of the oldest in the country. This market was build by the British for trade to take place  where locals can engage in all sorts of legal trade. It is a good spot if you want to enjoy real Gambian market life, with puzzling smiles and chants from sellers and buyers. It is one of the most visited place by tourist in the capital city of Banjul

title: moet je gezien hebben
text: super leuke markt waar je de lokale sfeer kan opsnuiven . hier kan je leuke dingen kopen die je elders in Gambia niet ziet . ook volledig veilig maar super druk ,

title: Som vanligt....
text:
Ännu en av dessa marknader....
Det är alltid intressant att besöka marknader i länder man besöker för att få en inblick i folklivet. Albert Market var inget undantag men den skiljer sig inte från andra marknader jag besökt; mycket folk, rörigt, bökigt och samma utbud.

title: En upplevelse man aldrig glömmer
text: En verklig upplevelse där man kan handla och njuta i en härlig atsmofär men man måste förstå lite av deras sätt att sälja sina varor och deras religion. går bra att pruta men man måste vara på sig om sitt pris ungefär 50% av deras pris kan man pruta. vänliga omtänksamma även om vissa kan vara påstridiga att sälja just sina varor.

title: Colorful markt in the open air ,
text: Colorful markt under a cloud filled with fruits and other products, .Besides food and chemistry, you will buy hand-sewn folk costumes here  and hand-made craft .Worth a visit .It  delights and encourages you to buy unforgettable handmade souvenirs .

title: Bustling colourful market
text:
Be prepared to haggle. Most stalls will start with a price 3 times what its worth so do haggle and you will get what you want at a price you want to pay. 
Lovely stall holders who can seem pushy but a no thank you usually does the trick.
Definetely worth a visit for the experience.

title: Typical African city market
text: This market is touted as the largest in Banjul. It’s best to go with a guide or someone that knows the place as it’s easy to get lost in the winding alleys and narrow ways. There’s lots to see and buy. It’s such a busy market with  everything under the sun, available. The sellers are quite pushy as everyone wants you to buy something from them. Thing is, all sellers start their prices very high and you must haggle for the best price. When you’re given a price, cut it below half and start haggling from there. Also be ready to walk away if you feel you’re being charged too much. It’s a bit like poker, sometimes with all the bluffing going on just to buy stuff but it’s part of the way of Albert market. Worth a visit to buy souvenirs and keepsakes.

title: with guide to be sure not to get lost
text:
Albert market is really a must see. It's big so getting lost is so easy. You are walking amongst sellers and buyers and the 'streets' are really narrow which makes it easy to get claustrophobia. taking pictues is really hard here because being so narrow the sellers do notice you taking a pic which they don't like at all. So be aware that they shout towards you or even are taking something to throw at you. 

We did it wit our guide Mamadi from Checkpoint Charlie tours. No stress, his task is to protect and serve and even walking at amongst the fishers on the beach gave you a save feeling. Don't forget to do that too. 

It's dirty and smelly, count on that but what a joy to visit.

title: Autentisk
text:
Et autentisk besøg på Albert market i Banjul. Her er en masse indtryk for alle sanser. Besøg gerne markedet med en en lokalguide. 
OBS. Her er meget dårlige toiletforhold
Man skal kunne klare “lugten” i de områder de sælger kød. Alle vil gerne sælge, det kræver en del afvisninger, men bestemt et besøg værd!

title: Banjul market
text: Best way to get here is to get a fixed price with a guide to help you navigate the market. It is huge and the risk of getting lost is big. It is not very touristy and you have everything from leather, to carpentry, tailoring and fish. The market has everything and try to stay calm. It can be quite stressful with all of the salesmen trying to get your attention. Therefore the guide is essential, even though he leads you to his companions in the market it helps. We went in the afternoon on a Monday and were practically the only people there. It was very special, I wouldn't say you have to see it.

title: Прикольно по африкански
text:
Африкпнская красота и колорит. Надо посетить. Купили, все что хотели , и даже что не хотели. 
Ну классно. 
Торговцы пристают сразу и много м естных попрошаек, но это не напрягает, если есть минимально опыт подобных стран.  Центральный рынок. От атлантика по берегу 10 минут

title: A real treat
text: Well there was everything here, all manner of smells - good and bad, people, sounds, things for sale and some astounding sights. Barter hard for a bargain

title: Interesting and busy
text: Go here to see some of the local life and understand how life in a third world country can be. Bring a guie or a trusted local if you feel insecure when being approached by bumsters. Most people here are really nice. Ask before taking pictures, som people will say no, ofters will be happy to pose for you (and do not charge). Some will even encourage you to take pictures of or with them. Be aware that this is a busy and sometimes dirty and smelly place so do not dress in your best clothes.

title: Hyperdrukke markt in het centum van Banjul
text: Je moet stevig in je schoenen staan, iedereen wil natuurlijk iets van je maar als je doorzet krijg je een fraaie inkijk op de dagelijkse gekte van deze markt.

title: Kleurrijk
text: Leuke markt waar je als toerist leuke dingen kunt kopen. Wel afdingen. Loop ook over de levensmiddelen markt, deze is wat authentieker.

title: Give it a try
text: Orderly and easy to navigate.  Alot better and cleaner than the market in serekunda. IF you are looking for it most likely it is in albert market, and the prices are reasonable.

title: Worth a visit if you are in Banjul
text:
We visited as a couple but with a guide - so pleased we did as I imagine I might get lost in the alley ways. Our guide also assisted us in taking photographs - the locals were not keen on the camera - but he stopped at a few stalls and bought some fresh ingredients for his evening meal - as he got into conversation with the stall holders we were then able to take some candid shots without offending. 
It's a warren of narrow allies, some stalls covered with bright sun umbrellas and some stalls in the covered market. All sorts on sale from the enormous smoked fish being sold from a wheel barrow to Sunday dresses and flip flops. Of course the usual fruit and veg. 
It's even possible to have a shirt tailor-made - several guys working away at their sewing machines at the back of the market. 
We spent half an hour here - could have easily stayed longer

title: Good local market
text: While the Albert market does have its share of mask/souvenir shops it is also a place for locals with fish, vegetables, fruits, ancient grains and prepared foods on offer.  It is not particularly clean but it was not intimidating at all.  We were happy to be in a place that did not feel like it was only for tourists.

title: Not as full-on as serrekunda
text: And thats a good thing sometimes. Albert Market has all the usual tourist-trap shops but is a working market and caters to the locals' needs, both domestic and commercial. A must is the fishing-village part just around the corner form the market - again, a real, working place, tricky to walk around but an essential visit if you want to experience something other than hordes of tourists clicking away.

title: The real gambia
text: Instead of the serrekunda market we went with our driver to albert market. Which is in the middle of the city center. They have various little shop. Dont expect to much. You see gambian selling food, fruit and clothes. You see the normal day of life where the heart beats. Also close to the ferries.

title: Koe aidot afrikkalaiset markkinat!
text: Kannattaa ehdottomasti käydä pääkaupungin suurimmilla markkinoilla Albert Marketissa ja tutustua markkinoiden tarjontaa, tinkimistä unohtamatta! Myyjän antamasta ensimmäisestä hinnasta voi tinkiä 40-50% pois.

title: Drukke gezellige markt
text: Met Falutours deze trip gemaakt. Eerst op Serrekunda markt geweest, deze markt is heel anders, veel kleding te koop maar heel gezellig

title: Jobbigt och rörigt
text: Barnen tyckte det var hemskt, jag också. Folk drog i en, en del blev sura och arga för att man inte besökte deras stånd. Väldigt smutsigt, obehaglig stämning, trångt och rörigt. En väldig labyrint och helt plötsligt hamnade man utanför. Gambia överlag är inte särskilt bra på att hantera sopor och här märks det tydligt. Det luktar hemskt och stranden är skitig och nedskräpad. Vi åkte hem till hotellet ganska omgående. Här är nog ett måste att du har en guide med dig, vi hade vår Yakob som tog hand om oss hela veckan, han vallade runt oss.

title: Intensivt myller
text: Härlig marknad med intensivt myller. Här har jag shoppat barnkläder i afrikanska tyger, träsniderier, korgar mm. Här säljs även matvaror. Alla är på dig och vill visa sina varor och allt ska prutas.

title: Leuke ervaring,
text: afdingen geboden. Vriendelijke mensen, zelfs als je niets koopt. Een hemelsbreed verschil met noord-Afrika waar je aangeklampt en niet meer gelost wordt.

title: Grotere markt, veel kleding
text: Leuk om doorheen te wandelen, vooral stoffen en kruiden zijn leuk. Je wordt er niet heel erg lastig gevallen. Prima om zelf doorheen te wandelen, niet zo groot dat je verdwaalt.

title: Mooi hier
text: Zo gezellig om hier te lopen we rommelig maar dat hoor hier zo en de mensen zijn hier egt vriendelijk en niet opdringerig

title: Nice!
text: Well worth a visit! Don’t forget to negotiate the price when you’re there. Not very big, but a nice experience with opportunity for shopping.

title: A must-see spot
text:
This is the main market in the city and is a hive of activity. There are shops on either side of the main street, but the market itself is off to one side and is a rabbit-warren of alleyways and stalls. You'll find just about everything on sale here but it is a great place to buy souvenirs. Some really good and colourful material on offer.

There are loads of sights and sounds. You'll probably find that young (and some not so young) men will offer to guide you around. It is probably worth accepting the offer of one of them, otherwise you'll find yourself pestered constantly and you simply won't be left alone to wander at your leisure. All they expect is a few Euros or dollars at the end of your visit.

Remember that bartering is near-mandatory here. A good gauge is to pay about one third of what the seller first asks for. Be persistent. If you start to walk away, your offer will generally be accepted. Even so, things are good value and, generally, good quality.

You cannot visit Banjul without coming here.

title: A revisit with a local and some serious shopping...
text: And she knew where to go, what she was looking for and what to pay.  Always of interest to me the colours the smells the bussle of activities. Got herbs and spices, house goods and bike bits lot cheaper that supermarket, cloth apparently better bought at Serrekunda, photos to follow.

title: It is a big market area...lots of walking around....
text: Yes...worth a visit for as short or as long as you wish.  Colourful and stimulating smeliferous.  Everything under the sun!  Much less hassle if you use a guide/escort for this part of a visit to Banjul.  Walk the fish market area and beach...including the to and fro for the local ferry boats.

title: Eye opening
text: A real insight into Africa. A must do experience for all the family. Not much to buy but great to see. Make sure you take a guide with you.

title: Local market
text: A large market selling food, clothing, house hold goods and live stock. It is a worth a visit to soak up the sights, sounds and smells. If you have a taxi here, your driver will probably show you around.

title: Targ afrykański
text: Każdy, kto będzie w Banżul powinien zobaczyć to miejsce. Można tu kupic dosłownie wszystko, od żywności po stroje czy też pamiątki. Atmosfera jest tu specyficzna i zapach też:) Jest bardzo, bardzo kolorowo.

title: Pala aitoa Afrikkaa
text: Oltiin Timo toursin retkellä Senegalin eläinpuistossa, käytiin tullessa piipahtamassa Albert marketissa. Ostettiin puuveistoksia niitä oli hyvät valikoimat, tinkiä kannattaa hinnasta 2/3 osaa ainakin pois. Kannattaa ainakin jotain ostaa, valikoimaa on tosi paljon. Käytävät ovat sokkeloisia ja melko ahtaita. Afrikan tuoksuja ja hajuja, tämä pitää kaikkien kokea jotka tänne asti tulevat.

title: Your typical African Market
text: Just your typical African Market.  Largest in Banjul but small when compared to some of the markets in my home country. Would be of great interest to Europeans. I was able to buy some local print shirts and dresses as souvenirs.

title: Albert Market
text: A local market in downtown Banjul.it is a daily crowded noisy busy market with cramped aisles like a maze.it sells everything & anything.not for the faint hearted. The main post office is on the same street.worth a visit to see activity.

title: Interesante pero un pocl hostil
text: No es que no esté acostumbrado a este tipo de concurridos mercados ni a la insiatencia acostumbrada de sus vendedores, pero no se si es por casualidad o si realmente es así, pero encontré un personal especialmente cáustico y impertinente. Pero aún así, el sitio está bien para verlo.

title: Para perderse
text: Un mercado de artesanías locales, con unos puestos geniales, donde el regateo es parte de la vida interna del Mercado. Ubicado en Pleno Banjul. Visita Obligada a quien va a Gambia.

title: INTERESTING
text: Albert Market is something to see. It is quite large and is very cramped. The aisles are extremely narrow. It is one of those market that purely shows you the way of life of the Gambian people. They sale old clothes, fish (mostly covered in flies), vegetables, nuts, household bits and pieces, cotton fabric and a bit of everything in between. You can even have some clothes made for you there as you will find some very talented dressmakers. This market will be a bit of a challenge for those who suffer crowds, noise and at time bad smell. Try to go in the afternoon as it is less crowed. If you find something that attract your fancy, don't forget to bargain... cut in half or more the price offered and get to a point that you are both happy with. Happy hunting.

title: digusting, full of flies, not worth visiting
text:
1. It was like any market in the world that had all the products there. The difference was that this one was truly disgusting. Fruits were rotting, there were thousands of flies everywhere. 

2. The people can be pretty annoying too. They hiss at you and try to call you in, but in a rude matter. 

3. No real places to eat and if you want to eat a proper meal, don't ever eat here. You might even get cholera if you are not careful. 

Seriously, don't waste your time and energy visiting, unless you have nothing to do and have time to kill.

title: Speciaal om te bezoeken maar...
text: De markt bezoeken is eigenlijk wel een must do als je er bent maar in het regen seizoen (nu dus)moet je de stink lucht en de gratis miljoenen vliegen en dat alles vies is wel op de koop toenemen. Maar om te bezoeken wel heel erg speciaal. Ben door het vele reizen best wel iets gewend maar dit is heftig hou er rekening mee.

title: Het echte Gambia
text: Deze markt is zeker een bezoek waard als je het echte Gambia wilt leren kennen, er is van alles te koop en de mensen zijn zeer vriendelijk

title: The 'Royal Albert' always worth a visit if in Banjul and an hour to spare.
text: Might be serious shopping for the initiated, fish, fruit and veg, fabrics or a browse around the many craft stalls at the back. Always a bargin to be had with a bit of negotiation and this time of year some real photo treats as the Gambians go about their daily routine, in colourful dress and close to Ramadam.

title: Handbag shopping
text: At the back of Albert market is the craft market is the craft area. We picked up a beautiful handbag and leather bracelet as well as a great piece of cloth all at the right price

title: a go to place to shop for just about anything
text: Albert Market, Banjul is indeed the go to place to buy anything, be it local art curios, local fabrics or readymade clothes, shoes and knic knacs. The advantage - you can find all of it in one place. The disadvantage - for people not comfortable with crowds, it can be a bit of an exercise. Vendors will call out, ask you what you want, show their wares. A lot of goods are cheap copies of famous brands but some shops also do keep originals if you have a keen eye. All in all a world in itself if you are unafraid to explore its winding by lanes. Happy Hunting!!

title: Bazar market
text: Wyglad Targ niczym w polsce tylko wiecej owocow egzotyk.super pokazane to na fotkach tego serwis duzo moZna sie dowiedziec.nim sie pojedzie zycie tam z tego co wiem od znajomy net z tad Tania jedynie dla turystow bedzie drogi lot.

title: IL MERCATO
text: Davvero autentico questo mercato nella piccola città di Banjul merita una visita per rendersi conto di come vivono gli abitanti del più piccolo stato dell'Africa

title: Beetje toeristisch maar wel goed en overzichtelijk
text: Fijne markt in de slaperigste hoofdstad van Afrika, lekker slenteren over de kleding en food market en handelen op de craft market

title: Lovely market with great people
text: Lovely market with fantastic people their was a lot to choose from the carvings were brilliant I did  uy a few but it was very hot when myself and my husband went the locals are very friendly the don't try and rip you of that's what I like I just name my price and this it but definitely worth a visit.

title: Leuke markt met aangrenzend winkelstraat
text:
De Albert market is een kleinere markt waar van alles te vinden is. Als je goed onderhandelt dan kun je goede prijzen krijgen. Ik kwam meestal uit op een derde of soms een kwart van de openingsprijs. Bij de kleinere dingen tot 100 dalassi (2€) deed ik geen moeite. De mensen spreken goed Engels. Ik heb daar een handgemaakte djembe gekocht (65 cm hoog en 35cm diameter) van ongeveer 9 kilo met een geweldige klank en inclusief tas.

Als je de markt uit komt heb je een 'nette' winkelstraat.
De markt van Serekunda is 3 keer groter, drukker en de prijzen zijn vergelijkbaar.

title: Visita tipica de la ciudad de Banjul
text: La capital, Banjul tiene "poco" que visitar, pero el mercado es uno de esos lugares donde la gente del lugar accede a realizar sus compras diarias y se puede observar las frutas, comidas... Lo mejor la zona de artesanía aunque un poco escasa comparada con el mercado de Brikama

userLocation.name: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain

title: Klimat dawnej Afryki
text:
Miejsce jest bardzo specyficzne. Kolorowe, tętniące życiem, duszne i śmierdzące jednocześnie. Przypomina mi nasz stadion X lecia w wydaniu lokalnym. Turyści są tam mile widziani pod warunkiem, że coś kupują. Łatwo tam znaleźć coś dla siebie. Ja kupiłem suszone kwiaty hibiskusa na herbatę, pyszne owoce baobabu i jeszcze jakieś super nawilżające masło shea. Inni brali koszulki, pareo, wyroby z drewna. Z całą pewnością warte odwiedzenia bez względu jak je ocenicie. 
Sprzedawcy nieco nachalni za to z podstawami polskiego.

title: Intensivt och komprimerat Gambia
text: Färger, dofter, människor från många olika miljöer och sociala förhållanden samlas på denna marknad. En till plats man inte ska missa!

title: Kaikkea !
text: Täältä löytyy kaikenlaisia käsitöitä. Sokkeloinen markkinapaikka täynnä iloisia myyjiä. Tinkiminen on osa kaupantekoa. Hinnasta pois 80% ainakin!

title: Real local market
text:
A peek into a real local experience of a market. Knowing that you won't be getting your groceries there, the people at the market don't hassle you but go about their way as usual. You can sit and have a drink at the end, and of course there's stalls where you can buy souvenirs.

I wouldn't venture in here alone, so coming with a guide would probably be best.

title: Excursietripje met gids vanaf Kololi's Senegambiabeach hotel
text: Geweldige ervaring om op deze "overdekte"markt met zoveel vriendelijke mensen met vele soorten koopwaar in winkel rijke omgeving

title: Market
text: Very interesting but very smelly and a lot of flies wouldn't go there on your own as quite scary don't think I would buy food, we went more for fabrics and gifts, and only pay 1/3 what they ask for.

title: Amazing place
text: Very interesting to see but very very busy , the shop owners are very pushy which can be a bit to much at times. Very interesting to see items being made although the fish can be very smelly and full of flies.  Amazing to see all the items on sale and a real look at gambian people and there life.

title: Bustling African market selling everything
text: This is the oldest & largest market in Banjul.  Here you can buy everything from food to household goods, and also local crafts.  Although Gambia is fairly safe, watch your purse or wallet.  Haggling is a must.  The craft shops will be very persistent but simply ask them to give you room and time to decide.  Many people do not want their photos taken so you need to ask first or be quick.

title: Banjul Market
text: Geweldige ervaring op de Banjul Market. Veel verschillende producten, veel kleuren, goedkoop en goede producten varierend van Afrikaanse kleding, sieraden, groenten, houtsnijwerk tot haarproducten. Wie kan onderhandelen over de prijs is hier op zijn plaats, anders een gids meenemen

title: אחלה מקום לקניות לכול המשפחה
text: מקום נהדר לקנו. הכל... בגדים לכולם להורים לאחים לילדים ולעצמנו בעיקר... בנוסף תכשיטים שעונים פרחים שעושים יפה בעין.... לאיקר יחסית לקניונים בסביבה ממש קונים הכל באווירה נעימה ובמחירים סבירים ונהנייים... מוממלץ

title: Gambia en general, nos encantó
text: Lugar increíble, sus gentes fenomenales, ningún tipo de queja. Hicimos muchas excursiones con un guía y un 4X4,  nos lo pasamos pipa. Tienen unas playas fenomenales. Los mercados son brutales.

title: watch out for the bumsters
text:
We tried to visit the market at our own, but Always hassled by different locals who wanted to be our guide, who knows the things always better and who are only intreseted in the tip.
The food market is different, don't mind the thousands of flies and the odeur.
Prices are rather high.

title: Albert market
text: Awful scary place. Full of bad smells and desperate people trying to make a living 😦😱😱👃We did buy a beautiful mask and met a holy man . Not somewhere I would return unlike Gambia itself. We have returned since Albert Market and enjoy other parts of Gambia

title: Gambian shopping Center
text: If you are curious about a classical african market you may have a short look because of bad smelling. You can buy some simple sovanuir for friends.

title: Afrika på en timme!
text: Här blandas alla dofter, och färger i ett enormt skådespel. Kvinnorna gör sina dagliga inköp av färsk fisk och grönsaker.

title: Ambiance assurée
text: La plupart des Gambiens ne possédant pas de frigo, ils font leurs courses chaque jour au marché. Faites y un tour et plongez dans une atmosphère authentique, faites de couleurs et de senteurs....

title: Härlig marknad
text: Väldigt stort, väldigt mycket att handla, väldigt billigt, pruta pruta pruta :) Vi åkte dit med lokal guide och kände oss väldigt trygga. Människorna är så trevliga och det är lätt att trivas. Absolut värt att åka dit! Man behöver mycket tid eftersom det är så stort

title: Chaotic but a very interesting experience
text: The smells (mostly pleasant) and the chaos makes this market an experience I shall never forget, but would definitely recommend as you need to be there to take it all in. You walk over rough ground through narrow channels between the traders and their stalls. They all call out to you to come and look at their wares and will almost plead with you to buy something and immediately start dropping the price even if you tell them you aren't buying, only looking. You have to be firm and walk away. I found it quite annoying because I really wanted to take my time and brouse properly. I might have actually spent more if I hadn't felt quite so hassled, but it's just a totally different culture. We had a guide with us who stepped in when he could tell we'd had enough of the hard-sell. I don't think I would have liked to go it alone! Not sure I'd want to go back either, which is a shame, but it's just not for me. As I said at the beginning though, don't be put off - go experience for yourself!

title: African market with all the noise and hassle
text: A very large market where you can find just about anythings from vegetables, jewellery, shoes to chickens and fish. Its easy to get lsot so dont turn away a self-invited guide, who will tell you he doesnt want money but at the end of the "tour" will complain you dint give him enough.

title: Surprised with this market wonderful place
text: Nice to mix with the locals who are all very friendly and polite. Varied market from carvings to general shopping and not expensive. Pleasant to just walk and grouse through the stalls and not being pushed into buying. Very memorable experience a must to visit

title: Ett måste
text:
Ett måste att besöka denna marknad. Men var beredd på att de vill sälja ! !
Påstridiga men charmen på marknaden överväger allt. Ett måste dock! 
Pruta, Pruta, Pruta

title: Albert Market w Banjul
text: Albert Market w Banjul, to pełen życia , kolorowy, afrykański targ. Handel trwa tu praktycznie przez cały czas, ciągle pojawiają się świeże produkty : owoce, ryby, skóry, meble , artykuły codziennego użytku. Tutaj można kupić turystyczne pamiątki jak również kartki pocztowe wraz ze znaczkami oraz wymienić pieniądze.

title: Tam możesz kupić piękne orginalne rękodzieło :-)
text:
Odpowiednie miejsce jeżeli szukasz niesztampowej pamiątki z Afryki.
Są tam trzy stoiska z prawdziwymi perełkami .
Piękne maski używane w obrzędach oraz okiennice i figurki
Polecam spróbować również Cat Fish wędzonej palce lizać

title: The Real Gambia
text:
Visited as part of a 4 in 1-day tour with The Gambia Experience. 
This daily market is a fabulously chaotic mix of colours, smells and movement with people going about their daily lives in a maze of narrow lanes. With so many traders it’s amazing that most people manage to scrape a living!
Bartering is the name of the game. Tourist can expect to end up paying what is the starting price for the locals!
A great experience and well worth a visit.
TOP TIP
Be courteous, always ask if you can take photograph of traders and their stalls. These are dignified people, not theme park extras.

title: Worth a look
text:
Worth a look, but not overly impressed. The prices are much more than the local markets you find and a lot of the items are not as well finished. However it is a good experience and as always you will meet a lot of friendly locals! I would recommend taking a guide/driver in with you to stop most of the hassle you get. 
Good fun and interesting to see how other cultures live and shop! 
The hustle and bustle of Gambian lifestyle!

title: Traditonal and colourful market
text: This is a traditional and hassle free market where you cab see how Gambia people shop, the produce available and experience the colour and bustle of real daily life in the area. There is a small craft market but the general humdrum and vibrancy of the market is the real attraction

title: Banjul's most interesting offering
text: We took a taxi from our Kotu hotel and, on arrival, our driver unexpectedly got out of the car to come with us - so glad as we got to see things we'd otherwise have missed - in particular the areas where the fish catch is brought in and, next to it, where the fish is smoked. We were also able to browse at our leisure without any of the usual requests to look in every stall. We've been lucky to see many similar markets around the world and always find it very interesting (once we've put aside our squeamishness!!) to watch how local people shop and what for. Our driver was stunned when he showed me the huge baskets full of oysters and I told him how much oysters can cost back home.

title: Authentic Gambia
text: This local market you have to see. You really get a glimpse of the locals' everyday life. Take a local guide with you.

title: Rynek
text: Super klimaty. Kolor, różnorodność,  zdziwienie 😲,  zapach. Nie za bardzo handlujący lubią gdy się ich fotografuje ;-) Kup coś a zrobisz świetne zdjęcie.

title: Good Market!
text: We went as a group and this market was a good market! Good prices (that you barter for) good variety of stalls and the locals are all very nice! We were stuck between going to this Market and the Serekunda Market but we decided on this one! Not sure what the Serekunda Market is like but this one was great for what we needed!

title: albert markt bezoeken
text: aparte markt, met een te hoge vraagprijs, een derde hiervan is normale prijs. Ga hier geen eten kopen, mooie soeveniers

title: Visit if it is the only market you have a chance to see
text: The area is alive with people, smells, and life.  I come to just walk through the area and ignore the vendors trying to sell most anything you can think of.  Having a local guide is helpful to guide you through the maize of paths.  Guides often help keep the people from hassling you.  While the meat and fish area may be smelly and upsetting for some, it is worth a visit.  This is one area in the country I had to be careful with taking photos.  The other side of the market opens to the beach area where you can see the larger boats and small boats unloading what they have brought in.  The market is Banjul at work!

title: erg gezellige sferr
text: Geweldige markt om eens te bezoeken , alle kleuren en vers fruit heerlijk, ook zie je dingen die hier echt niet kunnen, maar daarvoor ben je in Afrika en niet in nederland

title: Marker....
text: Plac targowy na którym można wiele kupić, dużo sprzedawców bardzo zachęcających do kupienia ich towaru ufff bardzo męczące :-)

title: a real eye opener
text: lots of hustle and bustle very vibrant great fun haggling for goods that you buy (please haggle because the trader love this and treat it like a game) many bargains to be had. i would advise you to miss the fish and meat market section it really stinks and swarms of fly but other then that was great fun

title: An explosion on the senses
text:
Go to the food market early in the morning (i think it opens at 8): everyone is too busy to bother with you, so for a brief time you'll be ignored and free to pass through unmolested and without being stopped by hawkers. The temperature is also much more tolerable at that time, and there are no other tourists. 
The sights and smells are not altogether pleasant, but a great taste of africa!

title: A real eye opener
text: A very interesting morning seeing different crafts and an insight into the daily life of the locals.Watched all the fish coming off the boats before being taken to the market to be sold.

title: Compras de ultima hora
text: Voy cada año a Gambia, y visito este mercado siempre los últimos días para darme una vuelta y hacer alguna vompra de última hora... La zona del mercado mas turística, mejor no la pises si no quieres comprar... Como en casi todos los mercados para "guiris" te dicen que sólo mires y acabas comprando... Jeje

title: Dit mag je niet missen
text:
Druk, maar gezellig. Onoverzichtelijk, maar leuk.
De markt die je gezien moet hebben opgesplitst in 3 delen, de locale markt, de toeristische markt en de groente en fruit markt.  Leuk om te zien en als je iets wilt moet je goed kunnen onderhandelen, anders betaal je teveel. Zonder gids ben je verloren,  maar als je uit de taxi stapt staan er al mensen klaar om je rond te leiden.

title: Interesting place to see
text: The craft market is very interesting and has amazing handicrafts. Always remember to bargain! The sellers are trying to get visitors' attention all the time, which is somewhat annoying. Having a local with you might help as he can show around but it doesn't help with noisy sellers.

title: Really local market
text: Small streets. Many choises. It is best to have someone local with you. You can loose your directions. Worth to see. It shows Gambling.

title: A highlight of you visit to Banjul
text: As above a highlight to your visit to Banjul , Been several times , just back JAN 16 ,, originally went with a Juice Boys from the Lacio as can be a bit daunting if never been before , however now visit un escorted ( they seem to know if you have been before ) and just a polite no will do . so deff give a visit it is a eye opening experience

title: Intressant
text: Intressant men något jobbigt, när alla säljare drar  i en och vill sälja sina saker. När vi är fyra i familjen var det lite svårt att hålla ihop.

title: Kleurrijk
text: Harstikke leuke drukke echt hectische markt. Ook heel kleurrijk alle groente word hier verkocht meestal zitten ze op de grond tussen de vis die er ok ligt....heel gezellig ook

title: Go early before it's too budy
text: This is a lively market used by locals, there was lots of food and flies, boys operating sewing machines as fast as lightening, many examples of local crafts, a guide of your choosing saves the hassle of being followed around by an opportunist who will want money for guiding you, we used the taxi driver, not really big enough to get seriously lost though, everyone wants you to look at their stall, bartering essential!

title: Pruta!!
text:
Kul marknad med massor av olika saker att titta på.
Pruta minst 50 % om du ska köpa något.
Det kan kännas lite jobbigt när alla försäljare sliter och drar i dig dock.

title: Go with a Local
text: When we arrived at Albert Market we were already with a friend, but another "market guide" came up and offered to show us around as well. It was helpful having others that know good prices as they helped us bargain. The craft vendors especially will try to get the best of you and are much more aggressive than the other vendors. Be firm in your prices; they may try and tell you that they're losing money if they give it to you for the price you've suggested but of course it isn't true. For a small wooden figurine or a flashy beaded necklace for example, 100 Dalasi each is sufficient. For a beach wrap, expect to pay approximately 200 Dalasi. At the end of our market excursion our market guide asked us for some money to buy a drink with, so expect to tip if you allow his services.

title: Gezellig drukte
text: een bezoekje aan de Albert Market is zeker de moeite waard voor iedereen die er nog nooit is geweest. Advies is wel om met een gids te gaan.

title: Almost a must
text: In Gambia you of course should visit a market. This one is big, a bit touristy but not too obtrusive. If you're prepared for a more genuine market (almost no tourists, smells, dirt, atmosphere!) go to Serrekunta...

title: Dip yourself in African smells and colours
text: Great place to taste Gambian folklore at its pure, harsh version. Especially worth visiting is its handicraft sector.

title: Dit moet je zeker hebben gezien!!!
text: Wij zijn op de Albert Market geweest en hebben er echt  in volle teugen van genoten. Als je de tijd neemt, zie je hier echt van alles. Ze verkopen hier groente, fruit, vlees, vis, stof, huishoudwaren, schoenen, heel veel van hout - gewoon te veel om op te noemen. Het is zeker de moeite waard om hier een keer rustig over heen te lopen. Neem in ieder geval een gids mee, wij waren hier de enige "Toubabs" (witte europeaan) en dat voelt zonder begeleiding niet echt prettig, Als je foto's wilt maken worden ze vaak boos. Dit wordt niet op prijs gesteld omdat ze denken dat de foto's verkocht worden. Naar enig uitleg mag het gelukkig wel. Albert Market moet je volgens ons echt gezien hebben als je in Gambia op vakantie bent.

title: not as crazy as Serekunda market!
text: Albert market caters for tourists and visitors more than the huge and bustling Serekunda market, but there is plenty to see and smell as locals go about their lives and the place is full of jostle and banter

title: Van alles te zien
text: Ga met een gids anders verdwaal je. Geen foto's maken zonder toestemming. Onderhandelen tot je er bij neervalt.

title: Not for the Fainthearted
text:
I had fun at this market, which is actually called Albert Market. It is not the usual kind of fun and you need to understand that it can be full of people on some days. Also understand that depending on where you go in the market, there can be strong smells of fish and meat, with flies in abundance sitting on the fish mainly. The market feels a little chaotic but if you go with someone who knows it, it is not bad. Do not expect to be wowed with amazing arts and crafts. This is a true third world market and some of the streets you might walk through are muddy with stones and holes randomly distributed. If you know where to go, you can also see a beach close to the market where boats arrive to sell their fish first to people waiting on the beach. You will also be able to see from this beach where the Atlantic Ocean and the Gambia River meet.

If you are not sure if this market is for you, ask yourself if you have seen a few third world countries and markets before. If you have, it should not phaze you. However, if this is your first experience of a third world country, it might come as a complete and overwhelming culture shock to you. Perhaps ask a taxi driver to walk with you and, if you feel you want to get out of there, you can then let the driver know. At least that way you have a quick escape.

title: Good market to visit
text: A better market than Serrecunda, not so much pressure or crowds, lovely to see all the colours and to smell all the different smells, and good to have a good barter for something.

title: Be brave.....
text:
dear traveller.  Be brave.

The sights, the sounds, the smells can all be over-whelming and the hangers-on (bumsters in the local parlance) who will magically appear, can be a total pain in the posterior --- but be brave.

Grit your teeth, ignore the bumsters, and go your own way, and you won't be disappointed.........  but time it right. To do the market justice you must allow 2 to 3+ hours and in the heat it can get stifling, so time your visit for either very early in the morning or the late afternoon, and don't forget your water!

title: 신기한 볼거리 가득
text: 직모를 가지고 싶어하는 아프리카 사람들의 심리로, 가발이 많이 진열되어 있어요^^ 고소한 견과류와 함께 둘러보면 좋아요~

title: Go here if you are brave
text: The smells are overwhelming here. Very lively place to see plenty of things you could buy, if you would live a life here in Banjul.

title: Banjul Market
text: the market is an eye opener - but do not go with out a guide!!   you will just get hassled from the bumsters.   we brought some wooden carvings - but remember to haggle, do no pay the price asked.   its a very different world out there but the people are lovely

title: Een gezellige markt met liefdevolle mensen
text:
Deze markt is een aanwinst in het dorp, fruit, kleding, sieraden en schilderijtjes die daar ter plekke worden gemaakt. Naaisters die druk bezig zijn om de mooiste jurken, blouses te maken. Zelf heb ik een mooi tweedelig pak laten maken van satijnen stof.
Een blouse met een rok. Ontzettend blij mee. De mensen zijn zo ontzettend vriendelijk.
Neem wel een gids van het hotel mee. Er zijn ook wel eens opdringerige mensen. Met de gids heb je daar geen last van.

title: Bara positiva upplevelser. Monkey park måste upplevas.
text: Gambia är ett fantastiskt land. Människorna är vänliga. Varmt och skönt. Vattnet och stränderna underbara.

title: SMALL CITY CENTER, FRIENDLY MARKET
text: WE TRAVELLED TO THE MARKET - TO ACTUALLY BUY AN ADAPTOR for my computer.  Whilst there we took the time to check out the market.  Alot of the artisans and tailors there are senegalese and the music yu hear blasted around you is also mainly Senegalese. Alot of second hand and chinese imports too (a growing scourge across our continent) and alot of colourful but  african outfits.  Despite the lack of tourists many items felt gearred to the tourist crowd. Not a very exciting market if you were to compare it to the kinds of fabric and tetxtile markets one sees in West Africa.

title: A must do
text: See,smell and hear how Gambians shop .A real experience This is a trip you could do on your own but a guide gives you so much information you would not otherwise know.

title: Busy Place
text: An interesting experience as you get to see how the locals trade and buy daily goods. It is however very food orientated so of limited interest to tourists. There are some craft stalls which sell local wood carvings and cloths - quality is good and we ended up buying a couple of articles to take home. The place is very crowded and could be a bit intimidating if you were on your own. We went with our taxi man plus a guy from the hotel so didn't experience any hassle from the bumsters. They also showed us around the town & port areas. Would recommend a short visit but take a minder.

title: Third World excitement.
text: This is an experience not to be missed. It's noisy and gives everyone a taste of the real Gambian experience. You'll only go once  cos' once is enough.

title: Lively Local Experience!
text:
A local guide is essential,but well worth the visit. A real taste of gambian atmosphere haggling for goods is a must aim for about half the asking price its fun and you'll get a great bargain. Everthing on offer clothes, shoes, trinkets, hand made arts and crafts goods wonderful array of local produce.
Will try to force you into deals or purchases but be firm and friendly if you dont want it say so!
Don't go on your own as the "bumsters" as they are known are relentless to tip or buy from them.

title: Textilier av högsta kvalitet
text: Överallt i Gambia finns marknader som säljer tyger med otroligt vackra afrikanska mönster, både batik och andra trycktraditioner. Men ingenstans är tygmarknaden så omfattande som den i Banjul, alltså den som också kallas Albert Market. En av Västafrikas största. Alla ni som älskar tyger måste åka hit! Här hittar ni allt. Det kan bli gardiner och annan inredning, men också unika kläder som kanske sys upp av lokala skräddare nära hotellet. Kom bara i håg att välja en skräddare som månar om kvalitet, och därför kanske tar lite mer betalt. Ändå är sådana kläder bäst att tvätta för hand. De är absolut inte sydda på ett sätt som garanterat klarar vår tvättmaskiner här hemma.

title: Visted to see local crafts
text: The friendliness of the people.  We went with a taxi driver who stopped any hassling by stall owners.

title: Een drukke gezellige kleurrijke markt met een geheel eigen cultuur
text: The Banjul market heb ik ervaren als een drukke gezellige kleurrijke markt met een geheel eigen cultuur. Met name de fruit en de kledingstalletjes. Het contact met de lokale bevolking aldaar was enorm plezierig. Geef wel bij een eventuele aankoop duidelijk aan wat je wilt. Al met al een leuke ervaring.

title: Get out of your hotel and see the people
text: this market is a must see, it's busy smelly and dirty, it's fantastic, it's great to see the local Gambians, rather than being stuck in your all inc hotel, bite the bullet get a taxi (very cheap) and go see the sights, we found it very safe.R

title: A must if you visit Gambia
text: Serrekunda market is huge so it a good idea to take a guide along to help you navigate, we spend a few hours at the Market experiencing the amazing sights sounds and smells never once did we feel threatened or had any hassle from the stall holders. Our guide Ba Ba I must say was marvellous and made sure we didn't get lost. Well worth a visit to see to have a real Gambian experience!

title: Good experience
text:
I probably chose one of the worst times to visit the market this year as it was rainy season, so the heat was pretty unbearable. Not the first time I have been to the market, and it surprises me every time I go. A very busy place, lots of items on offer from jewellery to cloth, watches to clothes and shoes. Please be cautious though it is very easy to get lost and with the heat dehydrated as well. The place is sprawling and if you don't take a trusted guide you will probably not enjoy it so much. It is quite an experience to visit such a busy place, but please be careful, the streets are a bit rough and you can lose yourself quite easily. I would advise not taking young children there as them getting lost could be a real problem. Take water and if you can find a trusted guide from one of the more well know hotels then take them also. You will find that once guided properly around you can enjoy some of the wonderful wares on offer, and also the prices, (if you haggle a bit then the prices can be really good). The atmosphere is pretty amazing, its just so busy and to be fair most people are friendly. Overall an experience that sometimes I enjoy, but when it is this hot not so much. 
Just remember: Take water
                          Take a guide
                          Don't take young children
                          Use your common sense when dealing with people

title: Moet je doen, en meer zelfs
text:
Banjul market, moet je zeker eens doen, maar nog beter is met een lokel de markten afschuimen, serecunda market, de market aan de haven daar heb je wel iemand van ter plaatse nodig om die te vinden en van de haven te voet naar toe te wandelen, zo passer je de schaapswerven als ik ze zo mag noemen maar daar zie je hoe ze ook hier vroeger de boten herstelden of en maakten.
Beetje mijn hart verloren daar in Gambia.

title: Local market
text:
You can find everything there. Food, clothes, spices, fabrics, fruit, chicken, presents, .....
do not forget to haggle.

title: My trip to The Gambia
text: A great place to visit if you enjoy a place that caters to the traditional family. There are wide range of food and items to get at the markets.

title: BOTHERED BY BANJUL MARKET'S MINDERS?!
text:
BANJUL, GAMBIA 18 MARCH 2014

This country was made well-known to the world thanks to Alex Haley and his book “Roots” which was made into a television series, and tells the story of a native of The Gambia who is captured as a slave and sent to Virginia in the USA and the trials and tribulations of his life.

Gambia which is only 4,360 square miles is the smallest country on the continent, and has a cooperative relationship with its neighbour Senegal, despite having separated from the federation of Senegambia in the early 1990's.  Its first historical accounts come from the Arab traders in the 9th and 10th centuries, it was then taken over by the Portuguese who subsequently sold the trade rights to the British, becoming a colony in 1899, before finally becoming independent in February 1965.

We didn’t dock until around 11.00 am, so had a leisurely breakfast and a good sail in up The Gambia river.  The shuttle bus service dropped us off in the city centre, at the Albert Market, where we went inside the market itself.   This was almost a repeat of the other markets we had seen, particularly in Takoradi, and had the same produce as in Ghana.  

We then decided to stroll around the surrounding streets and we very shortly gained a "minder", who started to point out various buildings, as I was photographing.  We had been warned by the ship that informal guides known as "bumsters" abound.  Initially we ignored him, but when it became too problematic, I told him to go away in Arabic, which not only surprised him, but also did the trick, and he melted away into the crowd.  We then picked up yet another, who purported to be from "the security" force (which he wasn’t); he had a badge round his neck to confirm it!  He also proved a pain, and we stopped at some genuine police in the streets to ask the location of the internet café for which we were looking.  Having made certain we were on the right track, we tried to ignore Mr. Minder No. 2 only to find the original guy several paces ahead.  So we then had two “minders” to ignore!

Off the main thoroughfare, the streets were rubbish-strewn and potholed.  Even though we were the only white people, we did not feel threatened because there were plenty of locals around.
 
We eventually came to the Internet cafe and ascertained it would be US$1 for an hour.  As the internet speed was really slow, and after checking there were no urgent emails, we left after 20 minutes, thereby fooling our two minders who may have been waiting outside when the hour had elapsed.  On arrival back at the ship there were many stall holders displaying their wares on the quayside and I was tempted and bought a scarf.

At 5.30pm in the evening the ship recorded the shade temperature as 99.7 F, - 38C!!  However several hours later for deck barbecue, many people repaired to the dining room because of the very cold wind across the open decks, and the residual dining room staff had to be augmented by pool deck staff.

title: A Typical African Market
text: You should know how to haggle and bargain to get the best deal. You can buy African crafts or clothes.

title: Druk, druk, druk....
text: De moeite om te bezoeken, maar pas op met foto's. Niet iedereen is graag gefotografeerd! Voor de rest is het hier een drukte van jewelste waar iedereen door elkaar loopt.

title: Banjul market
text:
Banjul market is a big traditionel Gambian market. You can find there all kind of traditionel products like dryd fish, fruits, vegetables and flavors. you can also find a small part of handicraftwork, leather, clothes, wooden mask, animals and figures.
It is a very busy market, many Gambians are comming everyday to this nice market.

title: Serrekunda market
text: Locals and ex pats have renamed this market affectionately smellykunda !!! It is an experience anyone visiting gambia must try, the array of shops and stalls is immense tip take a guide with you to help barter with the stall holders and to negotiate the market as it is large and sprawling. A must visit, throughly enjoyable.

title: good market
text: Excellent market for material, and also for wood - best there is apart from Brikama... worth walking down on the beach towards the barra ferry as well - as this is an experience...

title: A walk down the lanes
text: We had our taxi driver as a guide for this trip. I think we would have got lost in all the little alleyways otherwise. He took us to lots of interesting stalls and it was fun battering with the stall holders who were all so friendly. Pity about the rubbish everywhere but this was typical of The Gambia. Put up with it and the place is so interesting. We saw school children, having finished school, learning the trade of making the colourful clothes worn in The Gambia and even smaller children carrying trays of water contained in small clear plastic bags which added to the rubbish. Noisy and cheerful. A great experience

title: Survive This and You Can Survive Anything
text:
Yep, that's how they advertise this incredible experience & how true that is... Bustling, vibvrant, colourful and simply out of this world. Welcome to The real Gambia my friend... Here at Banjul Market one can buy almost anything from a single colour nut to chew throughout the day to a hundredweight of sun-dried lady fish...Just watch where you put your feet. Surprisingly very little hassle, so don't worry. Keep moving and enjoy. We certainly did...

All Good Things, Neville & Jill Pettitt (England UK)

title: Great place to visit
text: What can I say we really enjoyed our trip here. Really busy market full of locals going about the their business. Well worth a trip to see how the smiling Gambians go about their stuff.

title: An experience!
text: We saw a bit of the real life of the people of Gambia as, with no fridges, market day is every day. Crowded and colourful with sights and smells we are not used to in our ultra hygienic world.

title: a sensory delight
text: Everybody should go to this market, it is a sensory delight. This is a must visit, as photos do not give you the different smells and sounds. Get a good guide and this experience you shall never forget.

title: Hectic, Crazy and fun
text: Don't mind everybody approaching you, that is a part of the experience. You see how the majority of the local Gambians make business and what they mainly sell. Always bargain.. 90% discount and you will achieve a fair price.

title: No hassle.
text: Quite an experience, loads to see and all sorts of things for sale, as usual if buying dont accept the first price, it is mainly for locals, but they are used to tourists. Perfectly safe, just use a little common sense re bags etc.

title: Just a market
text: Good idea to go with a Gambian so you will be left alone. Most things that a tourist would want to buy can be purchased from hotel shop or other street seller and you will get the same price all you have to do his haggle

title: Be careful of the pick pockets
text: Ok market, not so big as compared to the ones in Nigeria. However, good for sight seeing, buying also and having a feel of The Gambia.

title: et gambisk kaos...
text:
moro å gå rundt å se men ikke så altfor mye å bruke penger på;-)
Var gla vi hadde kjentmann med for markedet er en salig labyrint med utallige boder og MYE folk!

title: Wszystko w jednym miejscu
text: Fantastyczny targ z wyrobami rękodzieła regionalnego. Za niewielkie pieniądze, można zostać właścicielem pięknych wyrobów z drewna rzeźbionych na miejscu lub też tradycyjnych strojów gambijskich, koszy z baobabu, batiku itp

title: OK for a trip
text: The locals proudly say you can buy anything at this market.  But it looks more like a car boot sale than any market we are used to.  The crowds and stalls might look intimidating, but the locals are harmless (if overfriendly).  Personally, I was not impressed, but others might want to try the experience.

title: Look at all markets.
text:
Banjul market is great and really colourful but if you are in Kololi, Serrekunda is as good if not better. Also, have a look at the market at the top of the Senegambia strip. All prices are negotiable and don't be intimidated by the hard sell. Be in control.
Clothes can be made at very reasonable prices. Make a fair price that you feel you want to pay. If it's refused, walk away without being rude. You will get what you want .
Give it a try.

title: Fargerikt på markedet i Serrekunda
text: Serrekunda er Gambias største by og har ett stort marked som ikke er så 'turistifisert' som det i Banjul. Fantastisk utvalg i bla stoffer av alle slag til en rimelig penge. Ellers er det mye morsomt å se. For ikke å snakke om folkelivet.

title: what an eye opener!
text: this market is nothing like uk markets,and you need a strong stomach with most of it,if you like haggling then you"ll love it, seeing how Gambian people live and work in these markets is a right eye opener and you really appreciate how clean and tidy uk markets are.

title: Kaos på markedet
text: Å besøke marked i Banjul Gambia er en prøvelse.Det er skittent, støvete,masse selgere som vil ha tak i deg og det er ingenting å kjøpe for oss fra Europa, Pass på lommeboken og mobilen.Det er trengsel overalt.Det beste er å gå sammen med en lokal guide,da finner du ihvertfall tilbake hvor du kom fra.Aldri mer dit.

title: You should go!
text: Fun, fun, fun! Lots of great shooping, African clothes, drums  and gifts to bring home. Banjul is a small city and easy to get around. The beaches are fantstic, cheap hotels. Keep in mind that Gambia is a muslim country and it`s wise to dress properly in public areas. Friendly People.

title: Great Gambian experience!
text: large African market where you can find almost everything! It is large, so if you are worried about getting lost in the maze it might be a good idea to take a guide along. It is much less hectic and overcrowded than Serrekunda market and most of the alleyways are quite wide. Large craft market that carers for tourists, but  more selection and cheaper than most others I have visited. If you like vivid-coloured abstract African paintings, ask in the craft market for Ebrima Jaiteh and other stallholders will point you to his stall where he paints while you watch..

title: You just have to go
text: The market is difficult to describe; it's more of an experience than an attraction.  I visited numerous times over a four month period between September and December while I was living in Serekunda and working in Banjul.   My experience, and the way I was treated by vendors and others, evolved over four months I was there. At the end, although I was never a native, I was no longer a complete outsider or merely a tourist.

title: Leuk om een markt in Afrika te bezoeken
text: De markt in Banjul een grote verscheidenheid aan artikelen, groenten, vlees, vis, maar ook kleden huishoudelijke spullen een heel veel toeristische artikelen, waaronder prachtig houtsnijwerk.

title: Market Trip
text: Go very early in the morning and there is not to much hassling, very dirty and noisy, once in a lifetime visit never to be repeated again.

title: Originele afrikaanse markt
text: Moet je van houden met heel veel kleine straatjes en een keur aan tentjes. Wel op je portemonnee letten.

title: Market
text: A very busy market place with everybody selling everything, nice experience. Barter! barter!! barter!!!

title: An experience not to miss.
text: As the title says, this is a not to be missed experience.  Allow yourself plenty of time, it is a maze and you will be sharpening up your bartering skills before you know it. Don't just look at the tourist areas, have a look at the food market as well, Tesco's will never seem the same again. Remember not to show too much money or it will seriously affect your bartering power.

title: An interesting ethnic experience but not necessarily a pleasant one
text: Banjul market is a crowded rather insanitary tradilitonal African market. You will need to be firm to avoid "bumsters" trying to act as go-betweens and consequently hiking the prices for their own unseen commission while expecting a tip form you afterwards.
